item.title: Predecessor 1.8 Update Adds World Shift Mechanic and A New Hero
item.content:encoded:
Predecessor is getting it‚Äôs next big update next week. Developer Omeda Studios has announced that version 1.8 of the free-to-play MOBA will go live on September 2nd. The update introduces a new map mechanic called World Shift and adds a highly anticipated hero, Demon King Akeron.

World Shift is a mechanic that changes the battlefield in real time. During a match, paths, objectives, and environmental hazards can appear or disappear, keeping teams on their toes.

‚ÄúThis isn‚Äôt just a visual upgrade,‚Äù Omeda says. ‚ÄúThe World Shift reshapes strategy on the fly, demanding swift adaptation and tight teamwork.‚Äù

Aside from the new mechanic, Akeron joins Predecessor as a tank/off-lane/jungle hero with a playstyle all his own. He can climb walls to strike from above and focuses on controlling areas while staying strong in extended fights. Players can tweak his passive, ultimate, and movement abilities to suit different strategies. Akeron is part of the ongoing Ashes of the Damned storyline, bringing the next chapter of the game‚Äôs story to life.

While those are the two major additions, Predecessor Version 1.8 also sees the launch of a new ranked season, battlepass updates, and even the launch in a new location: Japan. With the launch of the game in Japan, players will have a dedicated Asia server to provide the best connection possible.

Lastly, performance updates for the new with 1.8 include support for Nvidia DLSS with AMD FSR support coming later. Additional changes cover improvements to the in-game store, user interface, and mini-map.

Predecessor‚Äôs 1.8 Update launches on September 2nd for all players. Let us know if you plan on checking it out in the comments below.

For more Insider Gaming, read about how much CD Projekt Red has grown as work on The Witcher 4 and Cyberpunk 2 continues to pick up. And don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our newsletter.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: 60+ Developers Join CD Projekt Red for Witcher 4, Cyberpunk 2, and More
item.content:encoded:
As work continues on The Witcher 4 and Cyberpunk 2, CD Projekt Red continues to grow its headcount within the Polish studio. As part of the company‚Äôs latest earnings report, it was announced that the studio has 799 employees working on various projects.

CD Projekt Red Added 69 New Employees

Looking at the break down of the numbers, CD Projekt Red hired 69 new employees at the company between April 30 and July 31, 2025. Those new employees were placed across every team and project in development at the studio, including the aforementioned The Witcher 4 and Cyberpunk 2.

The Witcher 4 remains the studio‚Äôs primary focus, growing from 422 to 444 developers and maintaining over half of the company‚Äôs development resources. Cyberpunk 2‚Äôs sequel also saw significant growth from 96 to 116 developers, suggesting accelerated development on the highly anticipated follow-up.

MORE CDPR: Cyberpunk 2077 Sold More Physical Copies On Nintendo Switch 2 Than Digital

Other projects showed modest but consistent growth: Project Sirius increased from 48 to 51 developers, Project Hadar grew from 19 to 22, and ‚Äúother projects expanded from 14 to 17. The company‚Äôs Shared Services team, which supports all projects with functions such as quality assurance, data, localization, and more, increased from 131 to 149 developers.

This overall expansion reflects CD Projekt Red‚Äôs commitment to simultaneously developing multiple major titles while strengthening its operational infrastructure.

For more Insider Gaming, read about how the return of EA Sports College Basketball could be in serious jeopardy. And don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our newsletter.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: All Roblox Super Eleven Codes & Rewards‚ÄîEvery August 2025 Active Code
item.content:encoded:
Super Eleven is a soccer game in Roblox. Here are all of the current reward codes for August 2025, along with all of the expired codes.

Super Eleven is an emerging soccer game on Roblox. Just like other games on the Roblox platform, Super Eleven allows players to unlock some freebies by using reward codes, making life on the pitch easier.

Below, we‚Äôll keep a record of each of the active codes, as well as the ones that have expired, so players can keep track of which ones they‚Äôve used.

Every Active Super Eleven Code & Reward in Roblox (August 2025)

All of these codes below are active as of August 2025.

Make sure you grab every reward before the codes expire:

How to Redeem Super Eleven Codes in Roblox

To redeem codes in Super Eleven in Roblox, follow the steps below:

  1. Set up a Super Eleven account and like the game page in Roblox.
  2. Launch Roblox and log in to Super Eleven.
  3. Head to the lobby and click on the ‚ÄòCode‚Äô option on the left.
  4. Type in the code you want and press ‚ÄòRedeem.

If the code is indeed active, then you‚Äôll receive the reward. Remember, every code can only be used once per player account.

All Roblox Super Eleven Expired Codes

As of August 2025, we can confirm that the codes listed below have all expired.

Sometimes, expired Roblox codes are brought back. So, it‚Äôs always worth giving them a try. Some may still work with some accounts where they were never redeemed.

Where to Find New Roblox Super Eleven Codes

If you always want to be able to keep track of all the current codes in the game, then be sure to bookmark this page, as we‚Äôll be sure to keep it updated regularly.

New codes tend to drop first on the official Discord server, so joining that is always a good idea if you‚Äôre a committed player and want to be among the first to know.

Do you love the beautiful game simulators in Roblox? Then be sure to check out our Insider Gaming forum, where you can take part in some discussions.

We also have code guides for other soccer-related Roblox games, such as Strika, One Touch, Blue Lock, and Goalbound.

item.title: Battlefield 2042 Getting Double XP Events Until October to Make Battlefield 6 Rewards Obtainable
item.content:encoded:
You can earn free Battlefield 6 goodies from Battlefield 2042. The problem is that the grind is slow, and players have complained. In keeping with EA‚Äôs recent acknowledgment of player feedback, Battlefield 2042 players can expect regular double‚Äîand triple XP‚Äîweekends every weekend moving forward.

The Battlefield Team has once again heard your cries. The community has lamented how long it takes to level up the Battlefield 2042 Free Battlepass to obtain Battlefield 6 items. If you like your double XP weekends, your day is about to get much better.

Battlefield 6 Rewards Will Be Easier To Get With Battlefield 2042 Double XP

An August 29 update from the Battlefield Team (through Battlefield Comms) has recognized the negative noise surrounding the Free Battlepass in Battlefield 2042.

Here‚Äôs what the team has had to say:

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve heard your concerns that you might have missed out on an XP weekend already, or might miss one of the upcoming ones, making it harder to catch up and get all the items from the Free Battlepass you‚Äôve wanted. We therefore will have a double XP events every weekend until the Free Battlepass ends on October 7. Additionally, the last two weekends will feature triple XP gains, so keep those circled in your calendar!‚Äù

That‚Äôs right: Double XP every weekend basically until Battlefield 6 launches, and the occasional triple XP weekend for good measure.

There are countless items for you to earn in the Battlefield 2042 Road to Battlefield 6 Pass. The more you earn now, the greater your haul of cosmetics and bonuses by the time Battlefield 6 finally makes its way around.

Is this going to make you complete the entire Free Battlepass for BF6 bonuses? Is this a smart move from EA, showing that it‚Äôs prepared to listen to players ahead of Battlefield 6‚Äôs launch? Let us know what you think about the Battlefield 2042 double XP changes through the Insider Gaming forum.

Battlefield 6 Portal gameplay leaking and Cyberpunk 2077 selling more physical copies than digital on Switch 2 are more hot topics for you to check out.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Cyberpunk 2077 Sold More Physical Copies On Nintendo Switch 2 Than Digital
item.content:encoded:
Albeit a port of an older game, Cyberpunk 2077 was one of the big third-party launch titles for the Nintendo Switch 2. And while the game was both available in both digital and physical form, players clearly had a preference for how they wanted the game.

In its latest earnings report, CD Projekt Red revealed that of the game‚Äôs sales on the console, more than 75% of players bought the physical version of Cyberpunk 2077.

CD Projekt Red joint CEO Micha≈Ç Novakovski believes that the game sold well physically on the system because they included the full game, including the Phantom Liberty expansion, on the 64GB game card. Novakovski said that they believe players find the ‚Äúplug and play experience‚Äù attractive. He added that the Switch 2 enhancements for the game helped push it to a new audience, but he does think digital sales will pick up moving forward.

‚ÄúThis dominance of physical sales continues into the current quarter with additional stock orders coming in,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIn the long run, we expect the breakdown of sales between these channels to reflect our past experiences with the share of digital sales progressively increasing as time goes by. It‚Äôs worth noting that physical and digital sales channels have different economics. Digital sales naturally yield higher net revenue, while physical copies involve additional manufacturing and packaging costs as well as distributor fees.‚Äù

Did you buy Cyberpunk 2077 for the Nintendo Switch 2, and what format did you pick up? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, check out the full reveal of the final Early Access faction for Heroes of Might & Magic: Olden Era. And don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our newsletter.

Elden Ring Nightreign Is About To Get Even Harder In New Update

item.title: Battlefield 6 Portal Gameplay Has Already Leaked
item.content:encoded:
Battlefield 6 brings back Battlefield 2042‚Äôs popular Portal game mode. If you can‚Äôt wait until BF6‚Äôs launch to see what it features, a Battlefield 6 Portal gameplay footage leak has given us all a sneak peek of what to expect‚Äîdid someone say Battlefield 6 meets Only Up?

Battlefield Labs has returned. With the open beta now way behind us, it‚Äôs time for Labs participants to get back into testing and ensure the FPS sequel is primed and ready for its October launch. But, like with Labs before, you can expect leaked footage to appear from time to time. A new video has surfaced showing off Battlefield 6‚Äôs revamped Portal mode.

EA and Battlefield Studios are promising some wild scenes with the new and improved Portal mode. Players can build their own maps, and as we‚Äôve seen in a new leak from Battlefield Wire‚Äîeven homages to hit indie games.

A full 5-minute video shows off Battlefield 6‚Äôs Portal mode in the returning Labs test. It‚Äôs not the most compelling footage, admittedly, and will be a mere taste of the creations and chaos the community is bound to concoct. But in the video, the tester has assembled a mammoth-sized structure, intricately designed to be climbed.

Comments on the video compare the footage to that of Only Up‚Äîthe viral 2023 game in which you have to climb an entire landscape until you reach the top, risking total failure if you fall. Once at the top, the Battlefield 6 player looks down, and a full-blown firefight is taking place atop the structure.

BREAKING: Leaked Battlefield 6 Portal Gameplay üëÄ

BF6 devs claim Battlefield 6‚Äôs Portal Mode will keep the game fresh for years. To be honest, I don‚Äôt doubt it, and I‚Äôm excited to see what some creative people are capable of building in Portal.

Did you play much of Battlefield Portal in 2042? Do you already have ideas of what you want to make in Battlefield 6? Let us know through the Insider Gaming forum.
